item.title: Quoting Charles Babbage
item.description: On two occasions I have been asked, ‚Äî "Pray, Mr. Babbage, if you put into the machine wrong figures, will the right answers come out ?" In one case a member of the Upper, and in the other a member of the Lower, House put this question. I am not able rightly to apprehend the kind of confusion of ideas that could provoke such a question. ‚Äî Charles Babbage, Passages from the Life of a Philosopher

item.description:

The claude mcp add command only affects the current directory by default - it gets persisted in the

item.title: Quoting Kevin Webb
item.description:
One of the best examples of LLM developer tooling I've heard is from a team that supports software from the 80s-90s. Their only source of documentation is video interviews with retired employees. So they feed them into transcription software and get summarized searchable notes out the other end. ‚Äî Kevin Webb, a couple million lines of Smalltalk

item.title: Quoting mrmincent
item.description: To misuse a woodworking metaphor, I think we‚Äôre experiencing a shift from hand tools to power tools. You still need someone who understands the basics to get the good results out of the tools, but they‚Äôre not chiseling fine furniture by hand anymore, they‚Äôre throwing heaps of wood through the tablesaw instead. More productive, but more likely to lose a finger if you‚Äôre not careful. ‚Äî mrmince

item.title: Tip: Use keyword-only arguments in Python dataclasses
item.description:
Tip: Use keyword-only arguments in Python dataclasses Useful tip from Christian Hammond: if you create a Python dataclass using @dataclass(kw_only=True) its constructor will require keyword arguments, making it easier to add additional properties in the future, including in subclasses, without risking breaking existing code.
Via @chipx86.bsky.social
Tags: python

item.title: Quoting Christoph Niemann
item.description: Creating art is a nonlinear process. I start with a rough goal. But then I head into dead ends and get lost or stuck. The secret to my process is to be on high alert in this deep jungle for unexpected twists and turns, because this is where a new idea is born. I can't make art when I'm excluded from the most crucial moments. ‚Äî Christoph Niemann, An Illustrator Confronts His Fears About A.I
